caption: Amazing. Best wine pairing I've ever had and every food course was divine. Excellent service in addition. Highly recommend!
Service was cheerful and attentive, food was excellent and the wine pairings by Hayden were spot on.

One of the top ones in Oahu, near my place. fresh and healthy ingredients, that’s all the matters personally! I truly enjoy the food and service. The staff is well-trained, professional, they know/ introduce the details of every dish, which is a necessary for customers at some point.   The atmosphere there is nice.    Some dishes are creative. Overall, I’d say it’s a good one & you gotta try when you are here.

The bread is extremely delicious and fresh. They used a really premium and flavorful cut of beef for the steak. The cheese sauce ( we ordered cheddar ) was balanced and not overpowering. Overall, the sandwich was juicy and dense just like the cheesesteaks from Philly.
Top 3 meal of my life! Worth every penny! If you enjoy French cuisine, this place is a MUST! The foie gras is INSANE! 🤤
Service and Food incredible highly recommend
The staff was friendly and wore masks at all timesThe location was clean, had barriers with outside seating.Now to the food.
Innovative cuisine, impeccable service and beautiful setting. Definitely best restaurant in Honolulu.

Pros: Good craft cocktails. Really nice views.  Cons: My husband and I were staying at the Ritz for five nights in celebration of our honeymoon. Although we did not have a reservation to eat here for dinner, we simply wanted to enjoy a cocktail. If you do not have a reservation here, you are treated like a second-class citizen.  The vibe was so strange and standoffish from the moment we arrived. As someone who has worked the front of house at a three Michelin star restaurant, I was flabbergasted by the lack of “thinking outside the box” skills and five-star hospitality.  The situation: we noticed the restaurant and bar were barely 1/4 full. We are well aware of Hawaii’s uber strict COVID rules and have enjoyed supported Hawaii’s local economy by eating out as often as possible.  La Vie had by far the strictest rules we encountered during our ten-day stay. The rules really didn’t make sense all things considered- the restaurant wasn’t even half full, we had to test negative for COVID in order to fly to Hawaii, and we have to wear masks everywhere and sanitize constantly. Apparently, all of those factors don’t matter!  Instead of being greeted with a warm smile and welcome, a hostess with a nasty attitude gave us a look and really phony rejection response to our super simple, nice request to grab ONE drink at the literally empty bar.  Knowing how outlandish it was to tell hotel guests they couldn’t have one drink at an empty bar which spanned about 20 feet, I requested to speak with the manager.  The manager tried reasoning that they were expecting a reservation and since they hold reservations for 15 minutes they can’t seat us. I had to be the one to proactively request that if said party is a no-show, can we please be seated instead.  It was such a struggle. We sat on the bench outside for 20 minutes (meanwhile the restaurant is still pretty dead inside). Lo and behold...a party of one arrives at the bar. Somehow miraculously the manager found us a table and said we had to be out at 8. No problem- obviously we can have a drink in 1.5 hours (in fact, we each had 2 drinks in less time).  Here was the issue- the huge fuss they made and the plethora of nonsensical excuses they made, all with a really fake smile, just to accommodate us for our honeymoon as hotel guests. The manager then said literally five times “thank you so much for your patience” which made it feel really disingenuous because of how repetitive it was.  We had way better experiences at some of Honolulu’s more authentic dive bars and felt way more welcome. This was the strangest restaurant experience ever.  My advice to management: reevaluate your business model. We’re willing to dish out good money, but you need to be more accommodating. Work on people skills too.

La Vie at the Ritz Carlton is wonderful. Not only does the restaurant have a great view of the sunset, its staff and especially its food are excellent. Their menu changes but count on it being top notch. We did the choose 3 tasting menu and shared it family style. The plates are on the smaller side but with a party of 4 we were able to order practically every item on the menu. My personal favorite is the crispy frog legs. Probably some of the best I’ve ever had. Their asparagus and poached egg was also delicious. Don’t forget to pair your meal with a good bottle of wine. Their selection is excellent and Hayden their sommelier is great.  Definitely go to La Vie for a wonderful evening.
Awesome place! Everything was good, but particularly liked the white truffle gnochi, the A5 wagyu, the oysters, the foie gras, the chocolate soufle. The fish was ok. The pairing was great as well.
Such a wonderful place and the food is amazing
Delicious food, excellent service. Exceeded my expectations. Pricy? Yes. But it is worth it.
Remarkable in every way. Friendly, attentive service, surprising and delicious flavors, and a lovely atmosphere. Impeccable.

We were staying at the Ritz Carlton and tried the restaurant there.  The ambience wasn’t anything to write home about BUT...the food was amazing and the service was top notch.  You can choose between a 3 or 4 selection tasting so we tried a few things and shared between the 2 of us.  Hayden was our server and he was extremely knowledgeable and delightful.  Standouts to us were the oysters, snapper and smoked duck. Portion sizes were great and each dish had a sauce paired on top.  They served a complimentary mushroom brioche bread served with a truffle butter.  This stole the show and we sopped up the extra sauce with the bread.  We thought about doing a wine pairing but chose to stick with cocktails.  I would come back in a heartbeat given the different options and pricepoint with the best service.
First time in a French restaurant, tasty food and beautiful presentation. Relaxing atmosphere and nice staff. I loved it!

This place isn't joel robouchon or fine dining, but the food has harmony. The chef has some creative approaches such as fish with carrot sauce (btw very good), but also has a solid chocolate soufflé. I gave it a 4 star because of the atmosphere, the staff, and the food harmony. So if you visit the island this is a good place to stop for dinner.
Best food drink and staff in Waikiki!

La Vie was amazing!! The food was really interesting and tasty, the service was incredible, the ambiance and view were perfect for a special occasion and we left completely stuffed with yummy food.  My favorites were probably the lobster remoulade and the entrecote of beef, though everything was quite good. The house-made bread with the truffle butter was AMAZING. They kept bringing us more and we thoroughly enjoyed that. I liked the layered cake for dessert as well!

Great for a (special) date night. This is an expensive restaurant.  The dishes were delicious. Some were spectacular, others were just good. The bread was marvelous. The service is what took this restaurant to another level.  Thanks for the wonderful dinner, and the service to make it a night to remember.
delish & will definitely be back soon :)
(Translated by Google) The food is polite and the location and atmosphere are good. It's worth the return visit.  (Original) 料理丁寧でロケーションも雰囲気も良い所です。再訪の価値全然有りです。
Great cuisine; and the service was professional and friendly. We'll be back.

Stunning flawless meal, perfectly executed by chef and server Hayden. Even in gloves and masks they managed to pull off an elegant elevated world class dining experience with a stellar prix fixe menu. We loved the lobster remoulade, for gras, quail, salmon and scallops.... PERFECT ANNIVERSARY DINNER!!
Amazing experience there. Well worth it for your special occasions.
Great view and Great  foods
Beautiful view and delicious food.
Exceptional experience. The food is exquisite and the service far above average. Highly recommended.
Wonderful experience! Fantastic service, amazing food, and stunning sunset views!
(Translated by Google) It's in the Ritz-Carlton Residence. When I eat, I see the sea and the food is delicious :)  (Original) 리츠칼튼레지던스 안에 있는 곳이에요. 밥 먹을때 바다가 보이고 음식도 맛있어요 :)

Great dinner experience for this special dinner with wine pairing.  Considering the restaurant is open air, it was quite cool. After the sun went down I didn’t even notice it.  Same floor as the Lobby (7th floor)  checkin and also the same level as the pool and cabanas.  Not the cheapest place but the food was plentiful and filling for a restaurant of this caliber.
Amazing dining experience. The food and the service where outstanding. We definitely will come back to this place with a cozy atmosphere and a fantastic view.

Very friendly and welcoming staff, explained everything so well whenever they brought the dishes to our table. Each dish in the course we selected tasted exquisite and diverse. It was cozy and intimate atmosphere with a nice view. It was my father’s birthday dinner so they surprised us with a small cake- just in time when the fireworks ended :) it was a wonderful experience!

The food is great and the service was on par! Ask the wait staff a question about the food and they totally know the answer. Course menu only but you can change items if you don't like it or have allergies. Will totally be back.

(Translated by Google) The best spot for a date.  It's not near the sea, but you can see the sunset in winter and the Hilton fireworks on Friday night! !!  Choose 3 or 4 dishes from the course. There is no mistake in having good wines.  As expected, the owner of this restaurant is Japanese (only for the owner of the Hy's restaurant), and the food and seasoning are good, and it's delicious, which can be said to be a famous restaurant in Japan.  Is it a small amount? I was fully satisfied with the course (although not American size).  I especially liked caviar, quail and chocolate souffle.  You can also request a piano performance, so it might be a good idea to check out your favorite movie music and love songs (= ^ ･ ^ =)  (Original) デートに最高のスポット。  海際では無いけれど、冬場はサンセットがちょうど見れるのと、金曜日の夜にはヒルトンの花火が！！  お料理は3もしくは4品選ぶコースから。 ワインもいいものが揃ってて、間違いがない。  流石ここのお店のオーナーが日本人(ハイズレストランのオーナーだけに)お料理も味付けも良く、日本　いいや都内の有名レストランと言っても良い品のある美味しさ。  量的には少量？(アメリカンサイズでは無いが)コースで充分に満足できました。  特に好きだったのはキャビア、ウズラ、チョコスフレでした。  ピアノ演奏もリクエスト可能なので、お気に入りの映画音楽やラブソングをチェックしていくといいかもしれないですね(=^･^=)

The pre fix menu was absolutely devine!  I got the shaved abalone with caviar on silken tofu first of all.  Second, the foie gras.  Last, the Wagyu steak with beef tongue gravy.  It was such an epicurean experience with a few surprises in between.   I added the rest of our party's pics of their choosing as well. The view is amazing especially at sunset.
Amazing food flavors and great service!
Perfect dining experience.  Lively atmosphere, carefully prepared food and even better serving staff.  Pricing is more than reasonable considering comparable high-end restaurants in Hawaii.

Exceptional food and service! Amazing views (I was there after sunset). And the atmosphere is great! I will definitely come back and I recommend this place for everyone! This restaurant romantic and luxury in same time.

The experience was excellent! Although the portions were small, it was delicious. My experience was not only with the food, but it was and all around great, fun, everyone working there was extremely Pleasant. I will go back again.

(Translated by Google) French restaurant in the back of the bar next to the lobby of Ritz Carlton. There was only 3 menus, 4 menus or chef recommended, but I waited for the waiter to take 4 courses with 2 people. It was such a feeling, so the appetizer that came out first was given to me and my waist, but it was a happy miscalculation. All were carefully finished dishes. The combination of bread and trifu flavored butter was excellent. Thank you for the meal.  (Original) Ritz Carlton のロビー横にあるバーの奥のフレンチレストラン。メニューが3品、4品あるいはシェフお勧めしか無いのでゲンナリしましたがウェイターさんが気を利かせて4品コースを2人で頂きました。そんな感じでしたので最初に出て来た前菜は及び腰で頂きましたが、嬉しい誤算でした。どれもが丁寧に仕上げた皿でした。 パンとトリフュ味バターの組み合わせは秀逸でした。ごちそうさまでした。
Great evening sunset scene.  Wait staff outstanding.  Food superb.  It's in the Ritz Carlton so it is 5 star quality.  Experience the Life -  La Vie est manifique!  👍👍👍👍👍

Fantastic twighlight view with top customer service!! Great wine pairing not because I am a pro but I got drunk that night. Classy jazzy pianist, scenic view and food course to complete my satisfaction. I personally think the experience did worth the money and way beyond.

Exceeded expectations. Food quality service  best I have had in Hawaii. Would be nice if they were in a good space. Atmosphere lighting privacy the fact people walk through the restaurant very disappointing.

(Translated by Google) "Lavi" opened on 08/01/2019.  Originally, the restaurant called “The Market” was renewed and it was divided into casual French “Lavi” and “The Lounge”.  For dinner, choose a 3 or 5 course and choose the number of dishes from the menu. So, for example, in the 3 course, you can choose 3 desserts or 3 steaks.  Mr. Itamae, the main sushi master, said that the taste has improved considerably.  (Original) 2019/08/01にオープンした「ラヴィ」。  もともとはザ・マーケットというレストランをリニューアルして、カジュアルフレンチの「ラヴィ」と「ザ・ラウンジ」に別けたみたい。  ディナーは、3品コースか5品コースを選択し、メニューからその品数だけ選ぶスタイル。 なので、例えば3品コースで、デザートを3品とか、ステーキを３つみたいな選び方も出来る。  すし匠のメインの板前さんがかなり味も良くなったと話していた。
